SENT.plain: Epstein-Barr virus (EBV)-associated lymphoproliferative disease (LPD) is a life-threatening complication following hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT)
Therefore, early diagnosis of EBV reactivation and pre-emptive therapy may be clinically useful
We report three patients who presented with an extremely high EBV load in peripheral blood mononuclear cells and plasma without evidence of EBV disease
Following pre-emptive therapy with a single dose of rituximab, a concordant decrease of EBV-genome copies and B lymphocytes was observed
In all three patients, no EBV-associated LPD occurred
We conclude that pre-emptive therapy with rituximab appears to be effective for prevention of EBV-associated LPD after HSCT
